description: Borrowed from Cree ocêk, otchek (“fisher”), borrowed from Ojibwe ojiig (“fisher, marten”), or a similar term in a related Algonquian language, subsequently reapplied to the groundhog.
An earlier form of this word, woodshock, still sometimes designates the marten.

entries.meaning: A rodent of the family Sciuridae, belonging to the group of large ground squirrels known as marmots, Marmota monax.
examples: Synonyms: groundhog, whistle pig, land-beaver, moonack
